div.head: Letter from Munson to Brother
div.p: I received youre you're kind favours a few days ago and I now hasten a reply. I was glad to hear that all was well and in good spirits. I have no news to give you at pressent present but in reply to youre letter I think that it would bea doing injustice to you and also myself not to say something to you about how I am getting allong in college persuits I have concluded with the advice of you and all other friends and relations that a regular course of studies would bea better now and in future for me and I have there fore conclude that what time I have to spend in obtaining this most precious gift which can bea bestowed mankind in general that I will myself try and get as complete a knowledge of all the languages as the time I have to spend uppon this all important subject will admit. I have there fore began a regular course and if there is any possicle chance of reaping any honours I will try and do my part. I hope that you will not think that I am flattering myself of ever becomming a great man ye I intind to improve my time as much as I possibly can.

I wish that you could no some of our professors especially Dr Longstreat you would think that did not have enough sense to find his way from the chappel
back home again but when you come to converce with him you will find him to be about as smart a man as ever youre Dr Finley of anny others man who moves in so small a circle

But if you should chance to get in company with Dr. Means you would not find in his manners an appearance a more genteel man in the south or I dout whether you woul find wone better informed uppon anny subject.

you must write first oppertunity and give me a full account of all youre occupations and tell me how you all are a getting allong with the sugar crop. tell George Milasis and little Mary Jane that they mus write to m as they donte know how much pleasure it affords me to get anny thing from home now I donte wante you to answer this short letter but you mus tell sister to do it you stated in youre letter that she though that I had slighted her but if so it was not intentionally and I hope that she will look over this and I will try and make up for it uppon the other sid.
